channel.title: Software to track bandwidth usage of a single application
channel.description:
I currently use 3 droplets with digital ocean for cryptocurrency wallets. I want to monitor how much bandwidth each wallet uses per day. Digital ocean has a limit of 2tb per month with my plan and I want to see if I can utilize some of the unused resources without going over my limit. Digital ocean does provide charts for viewing my mbps usage but nothing that totals it up. I use Ubuntu 14 on the vps
After googling around a bit it looks like http://humdi.net/vnstat/ will do what I need does anyone have experience with this application or know a better alternative?

if that doesn’t work out you could try having tcpdump dump all your traffic into a pcap file and have something parse the file, assuming you know the addresses or ports the wallets use.
